result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick D Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all the mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment to be entered against the defendant.

*NO CONTACT WITH KAYLA E.
*NO NEW ARRESTS.

timeConds.notes:
*TIME STAYED UNTIL 4-5-16 AT 8:30 IN BRANCH 47. IF GOOD DEEDS ARE DONE COURT WILL ALLOW THE SENTENCE TO BE SERVED ON ES. 
IF THERE IS CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM, SENTENCE WILL BE SERVED AS STRAIGHT TIME.
*4/5/2016  Proof of community service.  Court permanently STAYED the 30 days.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 35 days time served.  The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work, school and treatment.
*Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. All mandatory fees, costs and surcharges are due by 09-19-2018. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
*Court waives all non-mandatory fees and costs due to defendant's income.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Derrick D Henderson
Current: N95W16216 Cheyenne Dr, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: 6611 West Burleigh Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich. Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr also made his appearance known. Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 35 days time served.  The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work, school and treatment.

Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. All mandatory fees, costs and surcharges are due by 09-19-2018. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court waives all non-mandatory fees and costs due to defendant's income. 

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Court will be down 03-26-2018. Case rescheduled to 03-19-2018 at 1:30 p.m. Parties notified.

PURSUANT TO Felony Division Directive 04-03 dated December 15, 2004 -
Per succession calendar this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 47, Judge Yang for sentencing after revocation of probation.  Sentencing transcript requested from court reporter this date. pg
Received from the Department of Corrections, Request for Sentencing After Revocation of Defendant's Probation. pg

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed:  letter dated 4/30/2016 from Good Samaritan.  Defendant has completed community service requirement.  Court permanently stays the 30 days condition time.
BAIL REFUND
3/14/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety/defendant.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Court ordered as a condition of bail defendant to pay all the mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment to be entered against the defendant.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for  ZERO DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
*NO CONTACT WITH KAYLA E. 
*MAINTAIN FULL TIME EMPLOYMENT
*NO NEW ARRESTS
*30 DAYS CONDITION TIME STAYED UNTIL 4-5-16 AT 8:30 IN BRANCH 47. IF GOOD DEEDS ARE DONE COURT WILL ALLOW THE SENTENCE TO BE SERVED ON ES. 
IF THERE IS CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM, SENTENCE WILL BE SERVED AS STRAIGHT TIME.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Review hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. Court vacates jury trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Amended criminal complaint to be filed on the final pretrial date.  Case adjourned to Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State requests an adjourned Status Conference. Court grants State request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. State informed the Court that this is not a domestic violence case. Case was reassigned to Judge Siefert. Parties were directed to go to Judge Siefert's court to address the matter and get a new court date. Case adjourned to Branch 47.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 09-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court, PRO SE.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Avery L Goodrich, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM032246  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-03-15
Bail continued as previously set.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kayla E.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Derrick D Henderson in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not want for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
